channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Pakistan says India fired missiles at 3 air bases. Pakistani retaliation underway
item.description: Pakistan said most of the missiles were intercepted and that retaliatory strikes were underway. It's an escalation in a conflict triggered by a massac...

item.title: VA says its job cuts will limit doctor, nurse resignations
item.description: As the Department of Veterans Affairs tries to meet President Trump's goal of cutting 15% of staff, vets are concerned there won't be enough doctors a...

item.title: Google will pay Texas $1.4B to settle claims over user data collection
item.description: The agreement settles several claims Texas made against the search giant in 2022 related to geolocation, incognito searches and biometric data.

item.title: Hawaii secures $700 million settlement in lawsuit over blood-thinner Plavix
item.description: The settlement divides the $700 million payment equally between pharmaceutical giants Bristol Myers Squibb and Sanofi.

item.title: Elton John and Dua Lipa seek protection from AI
item.description: They are among 400 artists appealing to Sir Keir Starmer, saying creative industries are threatened.

item.title: Newark, N.J. mayor arrested at ICE facility, charged with trespassing
item.description: Newark Mayor Ras Baraka was arrested at an ICE facility during a visit with members of New Jersey's congressional delegation.

item.title: Trump administration must halt some DOGE cuts at 20 federal agencies
item.description: A judge is blocking the Trump administration and Elon Musk's DOGE from carrying out sweeping layoffs at over a dozen agencies — at least for now.

item.title: 2nd radar outage for Newark Airport in 2 weeks leaves more flyers stranded
item.description: Newark Liberty International Airport suffered another brief air traffic control outage Friday morning, the FAA confirmed.

item.title: Pope Leo XIV’s Creole heritage highlights complex history of racism and the church in America
item.description: The election of Pope Leo XIV, who is the first U.S. pope and has Creole roots, is raising more awareness about the complexity of the Creole identity.

item.title: 'I freaked out and spent $400 online – it felt like a last hurrah'
item.description: How consumers are reacting to shipping changes that mean low-value packages entering the US no longer avoid tariffs.

item.title: No water, no power - Port Sudan reeling after week of attacks
item.description: The city, which has escaped the worst of the civil war, has been targeted in a series of bombardments.

item.title: Magic spells, innuendo and riddles: Your guide to all 37 Eurovision songs
item.description: With just a week to go, here's our guide to the songs and artists taking part in Eurovision 2025.

item.title: Trump fires longtime Librarian of Congress Carla Hayden
item.description: Carla Hayden has been the Librarian of Congress since 2016. She was the first woman and African American to hold the position.

item.title: How will Pope Leo lead? His first days may yield clues
item.description: Scrutiny about the way the latest pope might run the Catholic Church started the moment he stepped on to the balcony.

item.title: Why this U.S. ambassador cried at a press conference — and is being called a hero
item.description: Michael Gonzales, the ambassador to Zambia, announced at an emotional press conference that the U.S. would cut $50 million in aid due to theft of medi...

item.title: Cities aiming to thwart immigrant detention centers wield a secret weapon: local laws
item.description: As the Trump administration moves to quickly expand immigration detention space, a series of standoffs have emerged between city officials and the pri...

item.title: The pope is on the line: AP is there for pontiff’s call to his brother in Chicago
Judge pauses much of Trump administration’s massive downsizing of federal agencies
